Medicinal: Red maple is being investigated for use in cosemetics
General Information: Rhode Island's state tree that is used for the production of maple syrup

Used in Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) for more than 5,000 years, primarily to treat asthma or bronchitis. Has many other benefecial uses such as to help weight loss, treat cardiovascular diseases, but due to it's emerging side effects the FDA has disallowed the production
Source of vincristine and vinblastine, anticancer drugs used in the treatment of leukemia and Hodgkin’s lymphoma. Can be dangerous if consumed.
Reserpine is an alkaloid first isolated from R. serpentina and was widely used as an antihypertensive drug.

Source of industrial sugar and ethanol production.  Folk medicine treatment for wide variety of complaints from constipation to coughs, and has been used externally to treat skin problems and aid in wound healing. Both the roots and stems are used in Ayurvedic medicine to treat skin and urinary tract infections, as well as for bronchitis, heart conditions, loss of milk production, cough, anemia, and constipation.
Fruit and the tree's latex are rich in papain, a protease used for tenderizing meat and other proteins.
Juice of the pomegranate may be effective in reducing heart disease risk factors, including LDL oxidation.

Often called the "fivepound emon" due to its huge size the Ponderosa Lemon is believed to be a bybrid between a lemon and a citron, although it has never been verified. May be useful for lowering the risk factors for specific types of kidney stones. Being rich in Vitamin C can help prevent one from gettimg scurvy.
